intro: Ascyrum hypericoides var. multicaule, commonly known as the clustered ascyrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub with multiple stems, often forming dense clusters. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are borne in clusters and are accompanied by opposite, elliptical leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
